item.title: For Beginners â€” TCL Commands in SQL with Example
item.description: TCL commands are COMMIT, ROLLBACK, and SAVEPOINT. COMMIT: The COMMIT command is used to permanently save the changes made during the current transaction. Once a COMMIT command is executed, all changes made within the transaction become permanent and are visible to other users. Example: Suppose we have a transaction that updates the age of a student in the database: BEGIN TRANSACTION; UPDATE Students SET Age = 16 WHERE Name = 'Alice'; COMMIT; In this example:
